article.title: Search for electroweak production of charginos and neutralinos in WH events in proton-proton collisions at sqrt(s) = 13 TeV

choices: Strong production of colored SUSY particles.
Pair production of Higgs bosons.
Chargino-neutralino production in a simplified SUSY model.
Decay of the W boson into a lepton and neutrino.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the bottom right plot of Figure 2 illustrate?
choices: The transverse mass distribution of the lepton-EmissT system.
The contransverse mass distribution for signal and background events.
The invariant mass distribution of the two b jets.
The missing transverse energy distribution for various mass points.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the left plot of Figure 3 represent?
choices: The distribution of the dijet mass Mjj in the CR0b region.
The distribution of Mbb in the signal region after preselection level cuts.
The distribution of Mbb in CR2 after preselection level cuts.
The distribution of Mbb in CRMbb after signal region selection level cuts.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 displays the MT distribution in the CR0b region. What is the primary purpose of this region?
choices: To validate the modeling of the Mbb distribution.
To study the W+LF background and validate its modeling in the tails of kinematic variables.
To isolate the single-lepton top quark background.
To measure the cross section of inclusive WZ production.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from Figure 5 regarding the observed data?
choices: There is a significant excess of events in the signal region compared to the SM background prediction.
The observed data shows a clear deviation from the predicted signal distribution for the reference SUSY model.
The observed data is consistent with the SM background prediction.
The data in the two EmissT bins show a strong anti-correlation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the left plot of Figure 6 demonstrate?
choices: The observed and expected 95% CL exclusion limits for chargino-neutralino production as a function of mχ±1, assuming mχ01 = 1 GeV.
The correlation coefficient for the background prediction between the two EmissT bins.
The predicted yields for several signal models with the masses (mχ±1, mχ01).
The production cross sections for chargino-neutralino at NLO plus next-to-leading-log (NLL) precision.
